photo.title: Egg Castle, Naples

photo.description: Vesuvius forms the backdrop to a view across the Bay of Naples, with the "Egg Castle" in the foreground.
photo.tags: italy october 2006 bayofnaples vesuvius naples napoli volcano eggcastle
photo.title: Vesuvius and Naples

photo.tags: italy naples castle egg notredame architecture library architecturelibrary lantern slide
photo.title: Naples, Italy - Egg Castle

photo.description: On Friday after the EvoStar/EuroGP events wrapped up, Bill, Riccardo, Tyler, and I spent a couple of hours being tourists in Naples, starting at Castel dell'Ovo ("Egg Castle"). This castle sits on a little island just off the shore right in front of our hotel and the conference center, so we saw it the whole time we were there. Most of our time there was gray, and often wet, but happily Friday afternoon turned clear and blue (if blustery). So we walked over to the castle and wandered about chatting and admiring the many views. The castle was, of course, a whole complex is buildings and open spaces, with little winding passageways and doors all over the place. Terribly Old World, and quite wonderful.
photo.tags: evostar evo eurogp march 2008 naples napoli italy conference workshops event science scientific evolutionary computation evolutionarycomputation genetic programming geneticprogramming casteldellovo eggcastle castle walls passageways doors steps arches
photo.title: Doors and passageways

photo.description: On Friday after the EvoStar/EuroGP events wrapped up, Bill, Riccardo, Tyler, and I spent a couple of hours being tourists in Naples, starting at Castel dell'Ovo ("Egg Castle"). This castle sits on a little island just off the shore right in front of our hotel and the conference center, so we saw it the whole time we were there. Most of our time there was gray, and often wet, but happily Friday afternoon turned clear and blue (if blustery). So we walked over to the castle and wandered about chatting and admiring the many views. Tyler couldn't resist posing on the old canons, and I couldn't resist taking his picture when he did :-). Riccardo and Bill are in the distance against the light reflected from the bay. Interestingly, these canons were pointing at the city (right at our hotel, actually), rather than out into the bay...
photo.tags: evostar evo eurogp march 2008 naples napoli italy conference workshops event science scientific evolutionary computation evolutionarycomputation genetic programming geneticprogramming casteldellovo eggcastle castle canons tyler bricks brickwork portrait evening
photo.title: Ride 'em cowboy!

photo.description: On Friday after the EvoStar/EuroGP events wrapped up, Bill, Riccardo, Tyler, and I spent a couple of hours being tourists in Naples, starting at Castel dell'Ovo ("Egg Castle"). This castle sits on a little island just off the shore right in front of our hotel and the conference center, so we saw it the whole time we were there. Most of our time there was gray, and often wet, but happily Friday afternoon turned clear and blue (if blustery). So we walked over to the castle and wandered about chatting and admiring the many views. At the very top you could look down the sheer walls that went straight down to the ocean -- a quite vertiginous experience. It certainly helped one appreciate what a challenge it would be to try to attack this from the sea.
photo.tags: evostar evo eurogp march 2008 naples napoli italy conference workshops event science scientific evolutionary computation evolutionarycomputation genetic programming geneticprogramming casteldellovo eggcastle castle walls sheer drop ocean waves fortifications down
photo.title: That's a long way to fall (or a long way to climb)

photo.description: On Friday after the EvoStar/EuroGP events wrapped up, Bill, Riccardo, Tyler, and I spent a couple of hours being tourists in Naples, starting at Castel dell'Ovo ("Egg Castle"). This castle sits on a little island just off the shore right in front of our hotel and the conference center, so we saw it the whole time we were there. Most of our time there was gray, and often wet, but happily Friday afternoon turned clear and blue (if blustery). So we walked over to the castle and wandered about chatting and admiring the many views. This is another cool lamp - I love these things.
photo.tags: evostar evo eurogp march 2008 naples napoli italy conference workshops event science scientific evolutionary computation evolutionarycomputation genetic programming geneticprogramming casteldellovo eggcastle castle lamp light peeling
photo.title: A little light on a bright, clear day

photo.description: On Friday after the EvoStar/EuroGP events wrapped up, Bill, Riccardo, Tyler, and I spent a couple of hours being tourists in Naples, starting at Castel dell'Ovo ("Egg Castle"). This castle sits on a little island just off the shore right in front of our hotel and the conference center, so we saw it the whole time we were there. Most of our time there was gray, and often wet, but happily Friday afternoon turned clear and blue (if blustery). So we walked over to the castle and wandered about chatting and admiring the many views. Here we have Tyler and Bill being blown about a bit, with Vesuvius dimly visible across the bay in the background. I love what the wind's done to Tyler's hair and Bill's clothes :-).
photo.tags: evostar evo eurogp march 2008 naples napoli italy conference workshops event science scientific evolutionary computation evolutionarycomputation genetic programming geneticprogramming casteldellovo eggcastle castle mtvesuvius mount mountain vesuvius bay tyler bill portrait windy tourists
photo.title: A little windswept

photo.description: Photos from EuroGP/EvoStar 2008 in Naples, Italy, taken by myself and Tyler Hutchison. These are uncleaned and unedited; folks from the conference are welcome to use them as they wish. In, around, and from Castel dell'Ovo Friday after the conference ended. This castle was right in front of our hotel and the conference venue.
photo.tags: eurogp evostar evo 2008 naples italy napoli conference science scientific research evolutionary computation genetic programming march casteldellovo thiswasrightinfrontofourhotel panasonic castle eggcastle

This castle was right in front of our hotel and the conference venue.

photo.title: Lance Near Castel del'Uovo (Egg Castle)

photo.description: 28.12.2006: "Egg Castle" on the Bay of Naples
photo.title: Castel dell'Ovo

photo.description: Large Size - www.flickr.com/photo_zoom.gne?id=192565207&size=l It is translated as "Castle of the Egg". It is a local belief that the castle has a magical egg hidden in a secret dungeon that was placed there by Virgil himself, who was thought to have a wide array of mysitical powers to protect the city of Naples.
photo.tags: napoli italia castledovo castle hdr boats sky naples italy lucisart
photo.title: Castel D'Ovo

photo.description: Forse il più bel castello sul mare al mondo...
photo.tags: casteldellovo egg castle mare sea mergellina megaride borgomarinaro partenope napoli naples oldtown centrostorico campania italia italy
photo.title: Castel dell'Ovo

photo.description: Il Castel dell'Ovo, è il castello più antico della città di Napoli ed è uno degli elementi che spiccano maggiormente nel celebre panorama del Golfo. Si trova tra i quartieri di San Ferdinando e Chiaia, di fronte alla zona di Mergellina. Il suo nome deriva da un'antica leggenda secondo la quale il poeta latino Virgilio - che nel medioevo era considerato anche un mago - nascose nelle segrete dell'edificio un uovo che mantenesse in piedi l'intera fortezza. La sua rottura avrebbe provocato non solo il crollo del castello, ma anche una serie di rovinose catastrofi alla città di Napoli. Durante il XIV secolo, al tempo di Giovanna I, il castello subì ingenti danni a causa del crollo parziale dell'arco sul quale è poggiato e, per evitare che tra la popolazione si diffondesse il panico per le presunte future catastrofi che avrebbero colpito la città, la regina dovette giurare di aver sostituito l'uovo.[2] A causa di diversi eventi che hanno in parte distrutto l'originario aspetto normanno e grazie ai successivi lavori di ricostruzione avvenuti durante il periodo angioino ed aragonese, la linea architettonica del castello mutò drasticamente fino a giungere allo stato in cui si presenta oggi. ======================== O Castelo do Ovo (em italiano, Castel dell'Ovo; em latim, Castrum Ovi) é o mais antigo castelo da cidade italiana de Nápoles depois do Castel Capuano, tendo desempenhado até o início do século XVI, as funções de palácio real dos soberanos de Nápoles. É um dos elementos que mais se destacam no célebre panorama do golfo de Nápoles, localizando-se no ilhéu de Megáride. O seu nome deriva de uma antiga lenda, segundo a qual o poeta latino Virgílio - que na Idade Média também era considerado como um mago - escondeu no segredo do edifício um ovo mágico que manteria em pé toda a fortaleza. A sua quebra provocaria não só o colapso do castelo, mas também uma série de ruinosas catástrofes na cidade de Nápoles. ------------------------------------------------ The Castel dell 'Ovo, is the oldest castle in the city of Naples and is one of the elements that stand out the most famous scene in the Gulf. It is located between the neighborhoods of San Fernando and Chiaia, in front of the Mergellina. Its name derives from an ancient legend that the Roman poet Virgil - in medieval times was considered to be a magician - hid an egg in the dungeons of the building that held up the whole fortress. Its failure would have caused not only the collapse of the castle, but also a series of catastrophic disasters, the city of Naples. During the fourteenth century at the time of Joan I, the castle suffered severe damage due to the partial collapse of the arch on which it rests, and to prevent the population from spreading panic about alleged future catastrophes that have hit the town , the queen had to swear that he replaced the egg. [2] Due to several events that have partially destroyed the original look thanks to Norman and subsequent reconstruction work took place during the Angevin and Aragonese, the architectural line of the castle changed dramatically until reaching the stage where it is today.
photo.tags: castel dellovo palácio palace 宫殿 palais palast παλάτι palazzo 宮殿 궁전 дворец palacio landscape castelo castle 城堡 kasteel château schlos θθαστλε castello 城 성곽 замок castillo italia campania napoli neapel italien naples italy nápoles talie itália fortaleza chateau fortress burg festung schloss দুর্গ 성 कैसल キャッスル arquitetura arquitectura architektur architecture

Si trova tra i quartieri di San Ferdinando e Chiaia, di fronte alla zona di Mergellina. Il suo nome deriva da un'antica leggenda secondo la quale il poeta latino Virgilio - che nel medioevo era considerato anche un mago - nascose nelle segrete dell'edificio un uovo che mantenesse in piedi l'intera fortezza. La sua rottura avrebbe provocato non solo il crollo del castello, ma anche una serie di rovinose catastrofi alla città di Napoli. Durante il XIV secolo, al tempo di Giovanna I, il castello subì ingenti danni a causa del crollo parziale dell'arco sul quale è poggiato e, per evitare che tra la popolazione si diffondesse il panico per le presunte future catastrofi che avrebbero colpito la città, la regina dovette giurare di aver sostituito l'uovo.[2] A causa di diversi eventi che hanno in parte distrutto l'originario aspetto normanno e grazie ai successivi lavori di ricostruzione avvenuti durante il periodo angioino ed aragonese, la linea architettonica del castello mutò drasticamente fino a giungere allo stato in cui si presenta oggi. ======================== O Castelo do Ovo (em italiano, Castel dell'Ovo; em latim, Castrum Ovi) é o mais antigo castelo da cidade italiana de Nápoles depois do Castel Capuano, tendo desempenhado até o início do século XVI, as funções de palácio real dos soberanos de Nápoles. O seu nome deriva de uma antiga lenda, segundo a qual o poeta latino Virgílio - que na Idade Média também era considerado como um mago - escondeu no segredo do edifício um ovo mágico que manteria em pé toda a fortaleza. During the fourteenth century at the time of Joan I, the castle suffered severe damage due to the partial collapse of the arch on which it rests, and to prevent the population from spreading panic about alleged future catastrophes that have hit the town , the queen had to swear that he replaced the egg. [2] Due to several events that have partially destroyed the original look thanks to Norman and subsequent reconstruction work took place during the Angevin and Aragonese, the architectural line of the castle changed dramatically until reaching the stage where it is today.

photo.title: Castel dell'Ovo

photo.description: Castel dell'Ovo, a castle located on the former island of Megaride- now a peninsula - on the gulf of Naples. The castle's name comes from a medieval legend which tells that the Roman poet Virgil, who developed a medieval reputation as a great sorcerer as well, put a magical egg in the foundations to support them.
photo.title: Southern Italy 2010 - 005.jpg

photo.title: Castel dell ovo (Castle of the Egg) in the Bay of Naples, Italy

photo.title: Naples

photo.description: Naples, Italy. Castel dell'Ovo (Egg's Castle) rises upon the islet of Megaride, in front of the small promontory of Monte Echia (also called Pizzofalcone), which divides the two small bays on the waterfront of Naples: the one of the harbour and the other of Riviera di Chiaia (Mergellina). www.capriweb.com/Napoli/SantaLucia/sluceng4.html
